title: News Briefs 11-03-2021
cleaned_text:
The good news: Spring is almost here. The bad news: So is daylight saving time.
• Even worse news: The Monarch butterfly is becoming extinct.
• If you already had COVID, you might only need just one shot of the vaccine.
• The first black American military pilot led a stunning career in wartime France.
• Last Tuesday marked the anniversary of the day Americans learned about the COINTELPRO program.
• Pablo Escobar’s hippos might be filling in an ancient ecological niche.
• A wild experiment just got us closer to exploring extra-dimensions.
• Why smell and memories are so strongly linked in our brains.
• Investors are debating who should own the future of psychedelics.
• Is psychic abilities something that runs in families? Dean Radin and his team set up an experiment to find out.
• Our friends at Anomaly Archives need to find a new home.
• This ancient game board could be a missing link with the Egyptian Book of the Dead. Too bad nobody knows how it’s played…
• Popular Science takes a look at NFTs, the new trend that’s blowing up in the art world.
• Russians say ‘Nyet’ to partnering with NASA to build a lunar colony, and will team up with China instead.
• The misfortune of an actual UFO sighting.
• Red Pill of the Day: Sleeping inside a UFO at a national park sounds like the perfect vacation to me.

Quote of the Day:

If the words ‘life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness’ don’t include the right to experiment with your own consciousness, then the Declaration of Independence isn’t worth the hemp it was written on.

opengraph.title: News Briefs 11-03-2021 - The Daily Grail
